thread.title: Constancio Says ECB Will Act If There’s Material Risk to Prices
thread.title_full: Constancio Says ECB Will Act If There’s Material Risk to Prices - Bloomberg Business

author: Jeff Black
title: Constancio Says ECB Will Act If There’s Material Risk to Prices
text:
The European Central Bank will take further measures if it sees a significant risk to the outlook for inflation, Vice President Vitor Constancio said.
“I am confident that full implementation of the private and public-sector asset purchase programs, as announced, will lead to a sustained return of inflation rates toward levels consistent with our definition of price stability,” Constancio said Tuesday in Mannheim, Germany. “As always, the Governing Council stands ready to use all the instruments available within its mandate to respond to any material change to the outlook for price stability.”
A renewed slump in the price of oil and the surprise devaluation of China’s currency on Aug. 11 are adding to downward pressure on euro-area inflation, which was 0.2 percent in July compared with the Frankfurt-based ECB’s goal of just under 2 percent. The recent developments could lead to some downgrades to the ECB’s consumer-price forecasts, which are due next month.
Constancio said the central bank’s quantitative easing program to buy 60 billion euros ($69 billion) a month of euro-area debt is “open ended.”
At the same time, he said the slide in euro-area inflation expectations in August was due mainly to renewed declines in oil prices and is not in itself a cause for further action, such as extending the duration of QE beyond its initial end-date of September 2016.
“Monetary policy cannot and should not try to correct, because those effects will disappear one day,” he said. “ The price of oil will not go down to zero.”
